enrichment.AboutCourse:
Castle Newnham works in partnership with the University of Bedfordshire to provide you with a course that has a predominantly professional focus. You will undertake placements in two different schools and spend one week in a primary setting during your training. You will be supported throughout by a skilled, energetic and dedicated Creative Arts  team and an experienced mentor. \r
\r
Each Friday is spent at the University of Bedfordshire alongside other PGCE students.
enrichment.Qualifications:
Minimum degree required: Lower Second\r
\r
Applicants must possess a UK 2:2 Honours degree above or equivalent. At least 50% of the content of the degree must be in the subject in which you are hoping to train. \r
All entrants to have achieved a standard equivalent to a grade 4 (or GCSE A to C) in the GCSE examinations in English and mathematics. \r
\r
Skills Test\r
All applicants must successfully pass the NCTL pre course skills test prior to starting the course, you do not need to have passed the tests prior to attending an interview. \r
enrichment.InterviewProcess:
Interviews take place in the morning at Castle Newnham where you will get the chance to look around the school, observe a Drama lesson and meet our dynamic teaching team and our amazing pupils. \r
\r
In the afternoon, the interviews continue at the University of Bedfordshire.
enrichment.OtherRequirements:
Applicants whose first language is not English and who do not have GCSE grade 4 English language must have a valid IELTS certificate with a minimum score of 6.0 in each area of the test or an appropriate equivalent. Please contact the Admissions Team at The University of Bedfordshire for information on the equivalency tests that we will accept towards our entry criteria. \r
\r
enrichment.PersonalQualities:
Enthusiasm\r
You need to be enthusiastic and dedicated with great subject knowledge and the ability to enthuse pupils. \r
\r
School experience\r
It is desirable for applicants to have recent and relevant experience of working with children in a UK mainstream secondary school.
enrichment.HowSchoolPlacementsWork:
Over the year you will have two placements. You will spend four days per week in your school placement and Fridays are spent at The University of Bedfordshire with other PGCE trainee teachers.\r
\r
One of your placements will be at Castle Newnham School.\r
\r
At Castle Newnham School, teaching staff work in primary or secondary teams. We are firmly committed to developing the skills of all our staff and we are the lead school in the training partnership (Schools Direct) with the University of Bedfordshire. \r
\r
We hold weekly teaching and learning briefings to which all staff make a contribution to ensure we include evidence, research and debate in our practice\r
\r

inst.TrainWithUs:
Our partnership includes a group of very successful and growing secondary schools and a number of very well established primary schools. Each school has great experience in supporting trainees and new entrants to the profession and each is staffed by dedicated, ambitious and supportive colleagues. Trainees will find themselves well supported and with access to innovative practice and high-quality professional development. \r
\r
Why choose the Newnham Partnership? \r
Our partnership has been built on ambition - for our pupils and for our staff - and this includes our trainees.  Our schools are expanding and developing and always keen to recruit the very best new teachers to work with our wonderful pupils. \r
\r
Our trainees strongly recommend the course on the basis of the training they receive, as well as the feeling of being part of a warm and supportive partnership. \r
\r
